mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Tyler, Robert, 1816-1877
mdRecord.dcterms:description: States that he and Wise do not agree on Popular Sovereignty; claims that he does not want Wise to change his views, he simply wants him to manage them better; tells Wise this only because he is his friend and is genuinely worried about his political career; feels that Wise can not win if he openly declares against the President and the Party. Autograph Letter Signed. Printed in Auchampaugh.
mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, 1858 July 20, Robert Tyler, Philadelphia, Pennsylvania to Henry A. Wise
